Diabetic Gingerbread Recipe

Gingerbread is a classic holiday treat that brings warmth and comfort to any gathering. However, for those with diabetes, indulging in traditional gingerbread can be a challenge due to its high sugar content. But fear not, because we have a delicious diabetic-friendly gingerbread recipe that will satisfy your sweet tooth without compromising your health.

To make this diabetic gingerbread, you will need the following ingredients:

  • 2 cups almond flour
  • 1/4 cup coconut flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1 tablespoon ground ginger
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
  • 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
  • 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce
  • 1/4 cup molasses
  • 1/4 cup honey or a sugar substitute of your choice
  • 2 large eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Start by preheating your oven to 350°F (175°C) and greasing a baking dish. In a large bowl, whisk together the almond flour, coconut flour, baking powder, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg.

In a separate bowl, mix together the melted butter, applesauce, molasses, honey (or sugar substitute), eggs, and vanilla extract. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until well combined.

Pour the batter into the greased baking dish and smooth the top with a spatula. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

Allow the gingerbread to cool before cutting into squares or desired shapes. Serve with a dollop of sugar-free whipped cream or a sprinkle of cinnamon for an extra touch of flavor.

This diabetic gingerbread recipe is a healthier alternative to traditional gingerbread, as it uses almond and coconut flour instead of refined white flour and incorporates natural sweeteners. It still captures the warm, spicy flavors of gingerbread while keeping your blood sugar levels in check.

So, this holiday season, don't let diabetes stop you from enjoying the festive flavors of gingerbread. Give this diabetic-friendly recipe a try and savor the deliciousness guilt-free!
